Issues.Title: Documentation issue about using tabs in hero elements.
Issues.Body:
This is about **the Docs**. ### Overview of the problem Usage of tabs as suggested in the full height hero documentation is incorrect. This is about the Bulma **Docs** I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate** ### Description In the documentation about full-height heroes, linked [here](https://bulma.io/documentation/layout/hero/#fullheight-hero-in-3-parts), the code given for using tabs isn't the one suggested in the actual tabs documentation. The essence of the issue lies in the fact that tabs are supposed to just have a \
    element inside it for proper styling. The container element in the hero documentation should be a parent of the `.tabs` node, and not the other way around. Since it was the other way around, it was not possible to use `.is-centered` or `.is-right` on the tabs. ### Steps to Reproduce ```
    • Overview
    • Modifiers
    • Grid
    • Elements
    • Components
    • Layout
    ``` Add a `.is-centered` to the `.tabs` element. ### Expected behavior The tabs should be centered. ### Actual behavior The tabs were not centered.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Documentation issue about using tabs in hero elements." (#2562)

Issues.Title: Container height
Issues.Body:
Hi there,

I've just been looking at you [Container documentation](https://bulma.io/documentation/layout/container/).  
You have classes for **width**, such as `.is-widescreen`, `.is-fullhd` but you don't have any for **height**.

A comman thing to want to do it to postion a `<div>` in the center of the screen.  
I have made [a little CodePen example](https://codepen.io/luketobrien/pen/agrYKM) with a centered `<div>`, but I have had to add extra CSS rule to do that:

``` css
  height: 100vh;
  ...
  display: flex;
  justify-content: center;
  align-items: center;
```

Do you think you can add some classes for the height?  
Perhaps `is-full-height` or `is-flex`, `is-centred`?

> Note I used [Css Tricks](https://css-tricks.com/centering-css-complete-guide/)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Container height" (#2560)

Issues.Title: Cleaning up and fixing documentation - navbar page
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->
<!-- DO NOT REBUILD THE CSS OUTPUT IN YOUR PR -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is a **documentation fix**.

### Problems

Three problems are included in this pull request. I am referencing them all because they are on the same page.

1. Fix right drop down not being displayed on screens less than desktop-size
2. Fix drop up for the same reasons
![Before_RightDropdown_DropUp](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22060392/61165338-5f4aaa80-a4dc-11e9-89ca-ff3a8f2fbfdf.png)

3. Fix for overlaying menus on under "navbar colors" header
![Before_Colors](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22060392/61165352-843f1d80-a4dc-11e9-98a7-d4ca9c0c3160.png)

4. Inconsistent hero display for all examples
    - We may want to consider either coloring the hero banners differently or removing them because it is
a little monotonous. **Let me know in the comments** 
5. Fix for colorless hero under is-boxed documentation
![Before_IsBoxed](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22060392/61165365-a9339080-a4dc-11e9-8479-7665e166b934.png)

### Solutions

1. Add `is-active` class to the navbar-menu
2. Same
![After_RightDropdown_DropUp](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22060392/61165528-23fdab00-a4df-11e9-86e6-b75f7ba9fd27.png)

3. Add `z-index: auto` to each `.navbar`
    - Property included via the **new** `bd-navbar-color-example` class
    - Sass included in the `specific.sass` file
![After_Colors](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22060392/61165661-8b682a80-a4e0-11e9-86c8-fa1cbf91c11d.png)


4. Add HTML snippet for all the hero under navbars called `navbar_hero_filler_html` 
    - **Along with that** I noticed a lot of reuse of the same navbar items so I moved those into another 
HTML snippet called `navbar_items_html`
5. Completed By no. 4

### Tradeoffs

There may be a little overhead by including more snippets in the `navbar.html` file but i believe it is negligible. Plus the code reuse and ease of change is worth the extra few moments.

### Testing Done

Looked at multiple screen-sizes and especially those in which a feature was broken.

**Note:** The above screen shots showing the css working on the running site.

This feature does work.

### Changelog updated?

No.

<!-- Thanks! -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Cleaning up and fixing documentation - navbar page" (#2557)

Issues.Title: Container or Column not taking up the full available width of the screen
Issues.Body:
### Overview of the problem

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**

### Description

I have two columns: one for my vertical menu and another as my main content panel.
In my main content panel I have a container with a horizontal rule and a paragraph.

The container is not taking up all the available horizontal space on the screen unless I have a paragraph with a really long text.
Currently the container is only taking up the width of my longest element which is my paragraph.

### Steps to Reproduce

You can view the following example: https://codepen.io/howienoble/pen/qzRJvw
As you can see, the hr element is not taking up all the available horizontal space.

### Expected behavior

I would expect that either a column with the `is-full` attribute or a container with the `is-fullhd` attribute would use up all the available horizontal space available.

### Actual behavior

Neither my column nor my container are taking up all the available horizontal space.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Container or Column not taking up the full available width of the screen" (#2537)
